name: Taro
headline: On-demand career courses for software engineers
description:
Taro members get access to insider advice on how to get promoted at their company, detailed data on compensation, and invitations to exclusive networking events.

Taro focuses on the non-coding parts of the job, with courses + Q&A from leads at top tech companies, organized by level + company. The result is faster career growth for software engineers: improved onboarding, promotion, and pay increases.

Sample topics include how to optimize performance review, effective code review, and faster onboarding. These are the skills essential for career growth that don't get taught in schools or bootcamps.
tags: industry:developer-tools; industry:education; industry:community; industry:video; industry:creator-economy; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Rahul Pandey, Founder
founders.description:
Founder of Taro (joinTaro.com) to enable faster career growth for engineers. 

Deep background in teaching: Stanford lecturer, medium-sized YT channel (rpandey1234), and courses on LI Learning/Codepath.

I previously worked at Facebook + Pinterest, and spend most of my free time playing pickleball!

founders.name: Alex Chiou, Founder
founders.description:
Founder of Taro (joinTaro.com), which provides engineers with bite-sized actionable advice from top tech talent. Content is organized by company, level, and problem area. 

I love to build: I've published ~30 apps with 3 million installs combined in my free time. In high school, I built a YT channel with 50M+ video views.

My cofounder Rahul and I organically built a community of 17K+ people called "Tech Career Growth", which inspired Taro. Prior, I was a TL at Robinhood, Meta, and Course Hero.

Frequently Asked Questions
### What makes Taro unique from the other engineering learning platforms?
From tutorials to documentation, there are countless resources that teach you how to code.
Instead of specific algorithms or languages, Taro teaches you higher level engineering skills needed to advance your career.
Taro dives into topics like: how to be an effective tech lead, how to onboard successfully, how to prepare for interviews, and more.
For too long, engineers have neglected critical soft skills and leadership skills. Yes, we also think Rust is super cool üôãüèΩ, but articulating your ideas in a clear and concise way will pay more dividends.
These are the real skills that differentiate good engineers from great ones.
Taro is your secret weapon to build an enviable career. Check out our expert-led on-demand courses and Q&A forum to see what you've been missing.
### How have engineers used Taro to advance in their career?
Check out 100s of reviews on our [courses](https://joinTaro.com/<https:/www.jointaro.com/courses/>). Here's what two Taro members said:
I am absolutely fortunate to have found Taro. A structured way of getting mentorship is something I have been looking for all my professional life. I cannot wait to grow and share my success based on what I learned on Taro.
My manager has been dropping many hints that my performance was stellar last quarter. Taro Premium has made such a difference in how I operate and prioritize my time. I went from doing siloed projects with questionable impact to doing cross-org efforts with measurable impact.
### Who are some of the industry experts on Taro?
We love seeing new contributions each week from [experts](https://joinTaro.com/<https:/www.jointaro.com/experts/>): tech leads, directors, and experienced engineers.
Strong communities attract strong people: 1000s of engineers have contributed to our Q&A forum, courses, and events. You're the average of the 5 people you spend the most time with; don't let one of those people be a knucklehead on Blind or Reddit.
### How is Taro‚Äôs career content different from platforms like Blind and Reddit?
One word: credibility.
Taro differentiates itself from platforms like Blind and Reddit by emphasizing credibility and quality. While other platforms offer a broad range of discussions with varying levels of expertise, the content on Taro is created by verified experts in engineering.
Taro is intentionally transparent. By eliminating anonymity, we minimize toxicity. Instead of "TC or GTFO ü§¨" we believe in "TC if we can better help you! üòä"
### How often are there live Taro events?
Taro community members host career events several times per week. Our events include formal presentations with experts, interactive sessions with other members, and physical meetups in cities across the world. Many of our events come from members like you! If there‚Äôs a topic you care about, let us know and we‚Äôll help you make it happen.
### How can I access Taro content on the go?
We have mobile apps so you can take insights from Taro with you wherever you go! Check out our [Android](https://joinTaro.com/<https:/play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.randomappsinc.techcareergrowth&hl=en_US&gl=US>) and [iOS](https://joinTaro.com/<https:/apps.apple.com/us/app/taro-tech-career-mentorship/id1605094641>) apps.
### Is Taro free?
The Taro discussion forum is entirely free, and many of our events and courses are also free (and they always will be).
We limit deeper interaction to people who have joined [Taro Premium](https://joinTaro.com/<https:/www.jointaro.com/membership/>). This ensures a commitment to career growth and keeps the community high quality.
### Where can I get help?
Sometimes you just want to get feedback from an actual human. Here's how we enable that:
First, Taro members can ask unlimited questions in the forum.
Second, we hold regular private Office Hours. These are informal ways to get your questions answered (live!) from industry veterans.
Third, Taro Premium members get invited to our exclusive networking platform. Find referrals, practice mock interviews, or strike a conversation with engineers in FAANG or at startups.

Frequently Asked Questions
### What makes Taro unique from the other engineering learning platforms?
From tutorials to documentation, there are countless resources that teach you how to code.
Instead of specific algorithms or languages, Taro teaches you higher level engineering skills needed to advance your career.
Taro dives into topics like: how to be an effective tech lead, how to onboard successfully, how to prepare for interviews, and more.
For too long, engineers have neglected critical soft skills and leadership skills. Yes, we also think Rust is super cool üôãüèΩ, but articulating your ideas in a clear and concise way will pay more dividends.
These are the real skills that differentiate good engineers from great ones.
Taro is your secret weapon to build an enviable career. Check out our expert-led on-demand courses and Q&A forum to see what you've been missing.
### How have engineers used Taro to advance in their career?
Check out 100s of reviews on our courses‚ü®84‚ü©. Here's what two Taro members said:
I am absolutely fortunate to have found Taro. A structured way of getting mentorship is something I have been looking for all my professional life. I cannot wait to grow and share my success based on what I learned on Taro.
My manager has been dropping many hints that my performance was stellar last quarter. Taro Premium has made such a difference in how I operate and prioritize my time. I went from doing siloed projects with questionable impact to doing cross-org efforts with measurable impact.
### Who are some of the industry experts on Taro?
We love seeing new contributions each week from experts‚ü®85‚ü©: tech leads, directors, and experienced engineers.
Strong communities attract strong people: 1000s of engineers have contributed to our Q&A forum, courses, and events. You're the average of the 5 people you spend the most time with; don't let one of those people be a knucklehead on Blind or Reddit.
### How is Taro‚Äôs career content different from platforms like Blind and Reddit?
One word: credibility.
Taro differentiates itself from platforms like Blind and Reddit by emphasizing credibility and quality. While other platforms offer a broad range of discussions with varying levels of expertise, the content on Taro is created by verified experts in engineering.
Taro is intentionally transparent. By eliminating anonymity, we minimize toxicity. Instead of "TC or GTFO ü§¨" we believe in "TC if we can better help you! üòä"
### How often are there live Taro events?
Taro community members host career events several times per week. Our events include formal presentations with experts, interactive sessions with other members, and physical meetups in cities across the world. Many of our events come from members like you! If there‚Äôs a topic you care about, let us know and we‚Äôll help you make it happen.
### How can I access Taro content on the go?
We have mobile apps so you can take insights from Taro with you wherever you go! Check out our Android‚ü®86‚ü© and iOS‚ü®87‚ü© apps.
### Is Taro free?
The Taro discussion forum is entirely free, and many of our events and courses are also free (and they always will be).
We limit deeper interaction to people who have joined Taro Premium‚ü®2‚ü©. This ensures a commitment to career growth and keeps the community high quality.
### Where can I get help?
Sometimes you just want to get feedback from an actual human. Here's how we enable that:
First, Taro members can ask unlimited questions in the forum.
Second, we hold regular private Office Hours. These are informal ways to get your questions answered (live!) from industry veterans.
Third, Taro Premium members get invited to our exclusive networking platform. Find referrals, practice mock interviews, or strike a conversation with engineers in FAANG or at startups.

generated_description:
Taro is a startup focused on helping software engineers navigate the often-overlooked aspects of their careers‚Äîlike getting promoted and negotiating salaries‚Äîthrough on-demand courses. Founded in 2022 and part of Y Combinator's S22 batch, Taro is based in Redwood City, California, and comprises a tiny but ambitious team of three.

The mission here is simple yet profound: empower software engineers with the insider knowledge often absent from formal education or bootcamps. Taro offers a structured path with courses specifically designed to tackle those "non-coding" skills that can make or break a tech career. Think performance reviews, effective code reviews, and leadership skills. These are crucial for career advancement yet rarely covered in traditional tech training.

Right now, Taro has over 113,000 users, offering 94+ hours of courses and facilitating around 98.5K job opportunities. Their courses are taught by industry leaders from well-known tech companies such as Meta, Google, and Microsoft. 

Some noteworthy course topics include:
- **Ace Your Tech Interview**: Get the edge in securing that coveted position.
- **Nail Your Promotion**: Practical strategies to help you climb the corporate ladder.
- **Managing Up**: Techniques for building effective relationships with your superiors.

Taro promotes a community-driven environment, with candid discussions and networking events, ensuring that engineers are supported not just through courses but also through a robust community of peers.

So, if you're in tech and looking to level up beyond coding skills, Taro might just be the tool you didn't know you needed. Take a dive into their offerings and see how the right skills could unlock new opportunities in your tech career. Check them out at [Taro](https://joinTaro.com).
